titles.title: Expressing support for designation of a "National Veterans History Project Week".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Mr. Filner moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1644.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/30/2010--Passed House without amendment. Expresses support for the designation of a National Veterans History Project Week.Recognizes National Veterans Awareness Week.Calls on the people of the United States to interview at least one veteran in their families or communities according to guidelines provided by the Veterans History Project.Encourages local, state, and national organizations along with federal, state, city and county governmental institutions to participate in support of the effort to document, preserve, and honor the service of U.S. wartime veterans.
